alert.note: Alert for Sevier (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 7:28AM CDT until July 20 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following county, Sevier. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 826 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area in the next couple hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sevierville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Pittman Center, Harrisburg, Fairgarden, Elkmont, Wears Valley, Bird Crossing, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, Roundtop Mountain State Park and McMahan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are many low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
